thread.title: Employers Rethink Benefit Policies After SCOTUS Decision
thread.title_full: Employers Rethink Benefit Policies After SCOTUS Decision

title: Employers Rethink Benefit Policies After SCOTUS Decision
text:
Employers Rethink Benefit Policies After SCOTUS Decision October 14, 2015, 6:14 PM SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
The US Supreme Court's ruling to allow same sex marriage this past summer has a lot of businesses now seeking help with personal documents. 
Due to the change in law, businesses are reevaluating employee policies, benefits, and handbooks. 
"There's always risk, but there's been an increasing risk of employees suing employers for a violation of their rights. And those lawsuits, even if their employer ends up being succesful at the end fo the day, take a lot of time, energy and money," Jean Bender, an attorney with Davenport, Evans, Hurwitz & Smith Law Firm, said. 
Thursday, the Davenport-Evans Law Firm will be hosting a free event for area businesses answering questions concerning the law change. It will be at the Hilton Garden Inn in downtown Sioux Falls from 7:30 a.m to noon. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
